reviews.text: After reading reviews in travel articles I thought this would be a delightful small hotel with a lot of ambiance. Not a good decision. Finding the entrance to the hotel is a major challange after dark. It is a single locked door with no sign or light on a very dark street. No indication at all of the hotel location. I walked back and forth before discovering the entrance. Then it was through a dark courtyard to a tiny elevator up to the 3rd floor.
reviews.title: very disappointed

reviews.text: Alone and after dark this did not make me feel good. The front desk was not friendly when I arrived as they seemed preoccupied with something else. My room (actually bedroom/sitting area) was quite large, but very dark and cavernous. The only bright welcoming spot was the new sink/shower area. The wc was in a closet like area off the sitting room and old and musty smelling. The cold tile floors on 2 levels that you could trip over in the dark made a trip to the bathroom at night a difficult feat. Breakfast was very nice and the staff was friendly at that time. However there are many hotels in great locations and patios with lovely views in Florence. I would never stay here again.
reviews.title: For that tower we would return
great location!
reviews.text: We stayed in late Sept. 04 and the tower experience was AMAZING and I give it a 5, but since the room experience was a 3, I'm splitting the difference. The staff is FAR above the competition in regards to service - they were so wonderful with directions, suggestions, and help! And although our room and bathroom were absolutely huge and quite enchanting upon entry - the reality is that the tile floor (in both rooms) was cold in the middle of the night, we were too uncoordinated to keep the water in the curtainless shower, and this was the only hotel during our entire Italian vacation where we were swarmed by mosquitoes after dark. Despite the buzzing I'd go back in minute for that private view and the overall atmosphere. The nightly glass of vino while watching the sun set over all of Florence far outweighs any pesky mosquito.

My husband and I were in Italy in mid-Nov. of this year. I would recommend this hotel for several reasons. 1) The location is great. It is very close to the Ponte Vecchio and the Uffizi. 2) The staff speaks very good English and they are helpful and courteous. They recommended good places to eat as well as made the reservations for us. 3) We stayed in Room 10 which was a good size and clean and comfortable. If you were to pay the same amount for a hotel in USA you would expect more, but everything was more expensive there--especially hotels. What it lacked in amenities, it made up for in other ways. THe view from the tower is fabulous! It is a pain to get your luggage up to the hotel b/c you have to get on a tiny elevator to reach the 3rd floor lobby. The elevator could hold only me, my husband and our two suitcases! There is also a wonderful wine shop across the street.
reviews.title: This is a wonderful place!
not what I expected
reviews.text: My husband and I spent 3 nights in room 24. It was a Jr. Suite. The room was beautiful and spacious. My only issue was the small 'wc' room that gave off a bit of pungent smell and there were really no views from the room. But the main bathroom was large and the bedroom and sitting area were beautiful. The lack of view from room was offset by the wonderful tower. It was the best! And the service at both the front desk and at breakfast is the BEST. The front desk personnel spoke excellent english and were always very, very helpful in getting us reservations for the various museums, calling taxis and giving us general info. Each evening at dusk many of the guest gather to watch the sunset and have wonderful wine from the fantastic tower view. The wine steward is so helpful and friendly. The location is perfect to walk to all the important spots in Florence and great. This place had a lot of charm.

Location of this hotel is wonderful. Breakfast room and tower are just lovely, sitting rooms for reading and e-mail are luxurious. Room was oversized and more like a suite, and price was very reasonable in the guest house (1st floor). Room was clean, but bathroom was very small and smelled, which was somewhat unpleasant. Personnel were very accomodating and hotel was family friendly.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely setting
Greatly enjoyed the apartment!
reviews.text: Before we left to go on our trip to Florence, we checked out the reviews on the Torre Guelfa apartment. We were a bit skeptical at first as there were conflicting opinions from previous guests. I have to say that we found our experience to be absolutely wonderful! Although the hallways leading up to the apartment can be dark at night, there are light switches on the walls and a lit elevator. The rooms inside were very spacious and the ceilings were tall to accomodate lofts in each of the two rooms. The windows opened up to a charming cobblestone street where we frequently heard the clip-clop of horse drawn carriages. Nothing can beat the proximity factor the apartment has to town! It's close to everything! From the hotel manager to the housekeeper, everyone was friendly and helpful. We'd stay in the apartment again in a heartbeat!

This hotel is well-run and wonderfully located. It is well within walking distance to most of the tourist sites in Florence. The staff, while not overly friendly, was helpful and answered all of our questions. Breakfast was yummy. One morning, we had to wait to eat because the smallish room was filled. However, we only waited a few minutes.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Torre Guelfa leaves a lot to be desired. Even though my husband and I paid a lot of money to stay here, the room reminded me of a dungeon. The bathroom was extremely small and the sink for the bathroom was in the bedroom. Our room was located on the side of an alley, so we were awoken to the noise from the leather market carts every morning. We really could not wait until our stay in Florence was over. The best part of the hotel was the rooftop wine bar which does have a beautiful view of the Duomo and lovely sunsets.
reviews.title: We would never go to this hotel again.

reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel right next to the bridge. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were great. Can't say enough about the location!

reviews.text: The room was dismal at best. Needs to renovated badly. Altough, the bathroom was newer , clean, and perfectly acceptable. I think most of the rooms are in this condition, but we did see a suite, with it's own terrace that looked nice.

reviews.title: Can't touch this in Florence! Marvelous.
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is very good. A little hard to find and there is parking near by in a garage. The rooms and reception are on the upper floors of a building. There is a elevator, but it is very small.

reviews.title: Every room is unique!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Torre Guelfa in Oct 2006 on a Rick Steves Tour! While the hotel wasn't opulent or ritzy, it was fun because of how unique the hotel is! Every room is 100% entirely different in decor, layout, furniture, etc! I know this because people on my tour started going room to room just to check out what other people had. My room had extremely high cathedral ceilings & a HUGE window & really large armoire. My mom's room had a step-down from the front door area, wood flooring, and a canopy bed. My sisters room was so different! When you opened the door you'd have to go up an entire flight of stairs and then at the top was a small sitting area and a bedroom behind curtains! So cool! And, of course, the tower at the top is amazing for views. I'm attaching some of the pics I took from the top of it. When you stay at this hotel you really start to feel like "wow, I really am in Italy".... and since you can tell the hotel is so old, you really start to get a sense of history, especially when you go to the top of the tower. Now, be prepared, the accomodations aren't luxury - I'm a picky traveler so of course I wondered if they ever change the comforter on the bed, I know they didn't change the sheets every day, and the carpeting in my room as a little mildewy. But I don't regret staying here, it was just so unique & something that you can never really experience anywhere else!

reviews.title: Loved the Torre Guelfa
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Torre Guelfa. Everyone there was very helpful. Stayed in room 15 and the terrace was wonderful. We would take a bottle of wine up to the terrace each afternoon. The bell tower at sunset is the best place to be in all of Florence. Our friends had a junior suite and absolutely loved it. The bathroom was huge. The location can not be beat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights at the Torre Guelfa in Florence about a year ago. When the cab dropped us off, I thought we were at the wrong place. You go through some heavy metal gates and take the elevator to the reception room on the upper floors.
reviews.title: Best Rooftop Views Of Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a place!! A magnificent old stairway leads to the rooftop where you get the most amazing view of Florence from a bird's eye. In the afternoon you can go to the rooftop, have a glass of wine (hosted by the hotel) up and soak it all up. Florence is a busy, busy city--motorcycles, mopeds, traffic mixed in with all that amazing culture---and having a peaceful part of the city all to yourself made the experience one to remember.
reviews.title: Torre Guelfa apartments

likes.disliked: — Picking up the food, souvenir carts at about 5:00 a.m.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Customer service was excellent, the rooms were clean, and we left feeling we had gotten our money's worth. If I get the opportunity to return to Florence, I'll be here--on the rooftop.
reviews.title: Eccentric but wonderful

reviews.text: My husband & I along with my brother & his wife stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in Sept 2007. My luggage had been lost & the airlines called the front desk & left a message indicating I needed to come to the airport to retrieve my suitcase. I was exasperated. I had been without my luggage for 4 days & now I had to take a taxi to the airport to get my bags! Fortunately, the front desk staff called my airline & persuaded them to get my bags delivered to the hotel. I was thrilled. The staff went "above & beyond" ordinary service. The location of this hotel along with their high level of service makes it an outstanding choice in Florence! Sincerely, Becky Freed
reviews.title: Extremely Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here from Sept 17th through Sept 19th and I have to say that I was EXTREMELY disappointed. From the tub (not a shower) that had a hose to clean yourself off to the creepy closet that seemed out of SAW the movie. I was eaten up by bugs at night and the breakfast was something comparable to a Motel 6. The staff was nice but the room was terrible. I have stayed in pricely hotels (Ritz and Waldorf Astoria, Palace in NY) and in Motels like the aforementioned Motel 6. I am sad to say that this stay was MORE comparable to that of a stay at the Motel 6. I found a couple of hairs in the tub and we were only given 2 clean towels - no hand towels......just 2 shower towels. As for the furniture, there was a badly stained chair placed in the middle of the room. The bed was hard but I came to expect that in European or hotel beds sometimes so that wasn't a big deal to us. One last thing, the windows were sealed shut and the room seemed dark and creepy. I have to say that our stay at Torre Guelfa severely damaged my view of Florence - I don't know if I would ever want to return to the city let alone the hotel.
reviews.title: Never Go Back Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm giving this hotel 3 stars because I am averaging our bad experience with our friend's great experience. That is the problem with this hotel. As others have commented, the rooms are random within the same category (junior suite) and we must have had the worst (#25) which for 235 euros a night was even more painful. Plus the day and night shift desk attendants provide a very different guest experience. So if you can get room #29 and check in during the day it’s a much better experience for the price. Overall, I think you can find a hotel that costs less in the same area that will provide a decent room, but if you can ensure you will have a nice room then it could be worth the splurge for the tower.
reviews.title: Overpriced for worst room in hotel

reviews.text: Great location. Walk everywhere. One block from Ponte Vechhio and Uffizi. On a small side street with shops and restaurants. Parking is 26 euros/night so I recommend you not bring a car into the city. You won’t need it. The train station is 10-15 minute walk but if you have a lot of luggage I would suggest a taxi especially on arrival.
